intro: Celsia dentata, commonly known as the toothed celsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive toothed leaves and bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. Native to mountainous regions in South America, it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and shaded borders in horticulture.
